THREADITEM.name: Bracers of Aras
THREADITEM.edt:description: Made of flexible, silvery metal that wraps around wrists and forearms of wearer. Flexibility is a result of elemental water forged into bracers. Elemental water pieces used crafting resemble aquamarine gems, each piece approximately 1 inch in diameter. These arm bands are encrusted with pieces of elemental water. Color of elemental water gems constantly changes, oscillating with swirling effect across spectrum from deep aqua to bright blue.

edt:THREADRANK.keyknowledge: Name of mine from which the metals came used to create bracers

edt:THREADRANK.effect: Cast Gills Spell on himself for 2 Strain
edt:THREADRANK.keyknowledge: As mundane water contains oxygen, elemental water contains elemental air. Creators of Bracers of Aras formed gems from a mixture of elemental air and water. Ratio of water to air varies for each set of bracers. Wearer must learn ratio of water to air used for his bracers

THREADITEM.name: Counterspell Staff
THREADITEM.edt:description: A quarterstaff, topped with a crystal carved into any of shapes or figures. Most commonly made of wood, usually mahogany. With no threads like characteristics as normal quarterstaff

edt:THREADRANK.effect: Damage Step 5; cast Counterspell spell up to thread Rank times each day
edt:THREADRANK.keyknowledge: where crystal atop staff came from

edt:THREADRANK.effect: Counterspell’s Effect improves to +3 per Result Level
edt:THREADRANK.keyknowledge: Name of artisan who carved crystal on staff

edt:THREADRANK.effect: Damage Step 6; Counterspell’s Effect improves to +4 per Result Level
edt:THREADRANK.keyknowledge: Deed:Ritual (2 Blood Magic Damage) leaves a scar that occasionally oozes a drop of blood which is magically drawn to a notch in staff every 3 hours; Deed must be performed in jungle or forest where wood staff was created from was grown

edt:THREADRANK.effect: Counterspell’s Effect improves to +5 per Result Level
edt:THREADRANK.keyknowledge: Name of magician who created the staff

edt:THREADRANK.effect: Damage Step 7; Counterspell’s Effect improves to +6 per Result Level

THREADITEM.name: Crystal Spear
THREADITEM.edt:description: These magical spears are made of solid crystal. The shaft of spear is pentagonal and polished to fine sheen. Magic of spear keeps its blade razor sharp, despite is rough finish. With no threads characteristics as normal spear

edt:THREADRANK.effect: thread Rank increases range one quarter for each Range category
edt:THREADRANK.keyknowledge: Name of troll Sky Raider for whom spear was created (spear’s first owner)

edt:THREADRANK.effect: For 2 Strain, +2 to Physical and Spell Defense for number of rounds equal to thread Rank or until Attack Test with spear, whichever comes first. Spear glows pale blue while bonus is in effect
edt:THREADRANK.keyknowledge: what historic assault and which first wielder spear was crafted for

edt:THREADRANK.effect: For 1 Strain, +3 bonus to next Damage Test with spear. Spear glows bright red when bonus is in effect
Lower result level required for Armor-Defeating Hit by one level. For 3 Strain, spear causes 1 additional Wound on next Damage Test, so long as inflicts at least 1 Damage Point
edt:THREADRANK.keyknowledge: Deed: Must make pilgrimage to trollmoot of spear’s creator belonged. Character must swear Blood Oath with trollmoot’s leader. Damage taken for Oath is Permanent instead of Blood Magic Damage. If Oath is violated, spear immediately shatters beyond repair

edt:THREADRANK.effect: For 5 Strain, cause fear in enemies and rally own troops. Effect causes spear to glow bright white, pulsing like heartbeat. All allies within 100 yards receive: +1 to Initiative and Attack Tests and +1 to Physical, Spell, and Social Defense. Additionally, increase result level to hit spear’s wielder by one level. Effect lasts for rounds equal Thread Rank or until attack with spear, whichever comes first
edt:THREADRANK.keyknowledge: Deed: Must command airship in an attack. During attack he must invoke Names of weapon’s creator, original owner and trollmoot from which they came
